</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	ALUPREM
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales decreased 28% worldwide in 2015, primarily due
	to a decrease in volume, selling price and the impact of fluctuation in the
	foreign currency of 18%, 3% and 7%, respectively.&#160; The decrease in volume was
	experienced in both the U.S. and the European markets, which decreased 40% and
	10%, respectively.&#160; The decrease in volume and selling price was primarily
	related to a decrease in orders from a large U.S. customer, while the change in
	the foreign currency exchange rates impacted European sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	HITOX
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales decreased 22% in 2015, primarily due to a decrease
	in volume, selling price and the impact of fluctuation in the foreign currency
	of 16%, 1% and 5%, respectively.&#160; The decrease in sales volume of HITOX was
	primarily due to the continued weakness in the global TiO2 market, as well as
	aggressive pricing pressure from producers of white TiO2 in China.&#160; We expect
	conditions in the TiO2 market to remain difficult for the next several years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	BARTEX/BARYPREM
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales decreased approximately 5% in 2015, primarily
	due the impact of fluctuation in the foreign currency which reduced sales 3%
	followed by a 1% reduction in both volume and product mix. &#160;BARTEX, which is
	sold primarily in the U.S. market, remained relatively flat &#160;and BARYPREM,
	which is sold in the European market decreased 30%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	HALTEX/OPTILOAD
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales increased approximately 9% in 2015, primarily
	due to an increase in volume of 10% which was partially offset by a shift in product
	mix of 1%.&#160; The increase in volume was primarily related to an increase in the
	customer base.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TIOPREM
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales decreased 16% in 2015,
	primarily due to a decrease in volume, selling price and the impact of
	fluctuation in the foreign currency of 3%, 11% and 2%, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	SR
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales revenue from third party customers was
	approximately $14,000 as compared to $1,365,000 during 2014.&#160; While producers
	of white TiO2 in China have contributed to the overall weakness in the global
	TiO2 market, we typically only produce SR for our own internal consumption.&#160;
	Separately, we have made a strategic decision to take a portion of our SR
	production capacity out of service.&#160; We are currently supplementing our
	existing SR inventory with product produced by alternate sources.&#160; By making
	this strategic move, we expect cost savings as well as a reduction in our SR
	inventory levels over the next 12 months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER21">
</A>

	- 21 -
</FONT>

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

	increased 6%, primarily due to the sale of a by-product at TMM which was
	partially offset by a decrease in other product sales at the U.S. operation.

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP WIDTH=4% STYLE="BACKGROUND:#C5D9F1;HEIGHT:13.8PT;PADDING:0IN .85PT 0IN .85PT;">
<P ALIGN=RIGHT STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	$
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP WIDTH=12% STYLE="BACKGROUND:#C5D9F1;BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT;BORDER-TOP:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;HEIGHT:13.8PT;PADDING:0IN .85PT 0IN .85PT;">
<P ALIGN=RIGHT STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(6,131)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=TOP WIDTH=7% STYLE="BACKGROUND:#C5D9F1;BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE WINDOWTEXT 2.25PT;BORDER-TOP:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;HEIGHT:13.8PT;PADDING:0IN .85PT 0IN .85PT;">
<P ALIGN=RIGHT STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	-19%
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	ALUPREM
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in the United States decreased 40% in 2015, due
	to a decrease in volume and selling price of 33% and 7%, respectively, primarily
	related to a decrease in orders from a large U.S. customer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	HITOX
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in the United States decreased 21%
	during 2015, due to a decrease in volume and selling price of 18% and 3%,
	respectively. &#160;The decrease in sales volume of HITOX was primarily due to the
	continued weakness in the global TiO2 market, as well as aggressive pricing
	pressure from producers of white TiO2 in China.&#160; We expect conditions in the
	TiO2 market to remain difficult for the next several years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	BARTEX
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in the United States increased 1% in 2015,
	primarily due to an increase in volume of 2% which was partially offset by a
	shift in product mix of 1%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	HALTEX/OPTILOAD
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in the United States increased 9% in 2015,
	primarily due to an increase in volume of 10% which was partially offset by a
	shift in product mix of 1%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TIOPREM
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in the United States decreased 16% in 2015,
	primarily due to a decrease in volume and selling price of 3% and 13%,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Other
	Product
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in the United States decreased
	11% in 2015, primarily due to a decrease in selling price of 16% which was
	partially offset by an increase in volume of 5%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	ALUPREM
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in Europe decreased 10% in 2015, primarily due
	to the impact of fluctuation in the foreign currency exchange rate as the Euro
	weakened against the U.S. Dollar resulting in a reduction in sales revenue of 17%.&#160;
	Partially offsetting this decrease was an increase in volume and product mix of
	4% and 3%, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	BARYPREM
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in Europe decreased 30% in 2015, primarily due
	to a decrease in volume related to a decrease in orders from a significant
	European customer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	HITOX
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in Europe decreased 25% in 2015, of which 17%
	related to the impact of the fluctuation in foreign currency and a decrease in volume
	and selling price of approximately 7% and 1%, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TIOPREM
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in Europe decreased approximately $59,000 in 2015,
	primarily due to a decrease in volume of 50% and the impact of fluctuation in
	the foreign currency of 11%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">

<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	HITOX
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in Asia decreased 24% in 2015, due to a
	decrease in volume of 13% and the impact of fluctuation in foreign currency as
	the Malaysian Ringgit weakened against the U.S. Dollar of 11%.&#160; The HITOX
	market in Asia continues to decline due to the weakness in the TiO2 market, as
	well as the entry into the TiO2 market by producers of white TiO2 in China.&#160; We
	expect conditions in the TiO2 market to remain difficult for the next several
	years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TIOPREM
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in Asia increased $40,000 in 2015
	due to an increase in volume.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	SR
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales revenue from third party customers was
	approximately $14,000 as compared to $1,365,000 during 2014.&#160; While producers
	of white TiO2 in China have contributed to the overall weakness in the global
	TiO2 market, we typically only produce SR for our own internal consumption.&#160;
	Separately, we have made a strategic decision to take a portion of our SR
	production capacity out of service.&#160; We are currently supplementing our
	existing SR inventory with product produced by alternate sources.&#160; By making
	this strategic move, we expect cost savings as well as a reduction in our SR
	inventory levels over the next 12 months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Other
	product
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	sales in Asia increased $109,000
	in 2015 due to an increase in sales volume of TMM&#8217;s by-products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">

	&nbsp;

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Gross
	margin decreased approximately 9.1 percentage points in 2015.&#160; The decrease in
	gross margin is due to an inventory adjustment, primarily related to HITOX and
	SR inventory at the U.S. and Asian operations, of approximately $1,749,000 or 4.7%,
	a reduction in selling price of approximately $1,040,000 or 2.8% and idle plant
	expense at TMM of approximately $642,000 or 1.6%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Selling, General and Administrative Expenses
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160;Selling,
	general and administrative expenses (&#8220;SG&amp;A&#8221;) decreased approximately 7% in 2015
	primarily due to a decrease in salary expense which was offset by an increase
	in bad debt expense.&#160;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Interest Expense
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160; Interest expense decreased approximately 42% in 2015
	due to lower average short-term and long-term debt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

	&#160; We recorded an income tax expense of approximately $310,000
	in 2015.&#160; The 2015 income tax expense was primarily related to a valuation
	allowance taken against our DTA related to foreign tax operating losses at TMM.&#160;
	The following table represents the components of our income tax expense
	(benefit):
</FONT>

<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Liquidity, Capital Resources and Other Financial
	Information
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Cash and Cash Equivalents
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As
	noted in the following table, cash and cash equivalents decreased $1,844,000 from
	December 31, 2014 to December 31, 2015.&#160; Operating activities and financing
	activities provided $3,499,000 and $864,000, respectively.&#160; We used cash of $5,644,000
	in investing activities and invested $355,000 through non-cash investing
	activities.&#160; The effect of the exchange rate fluctuations accounted for a decrease
	in cash of $563,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Below
	are the major changes in working capital affecting cash provided by operating
	activities during the year ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<TABLE BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="6%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#9658;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1339" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:7.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Trade Accounts Receivable
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160; Trade accounts
	receivable provided cash of $861,000 from the end of 2014 to the end of 2015.&#160;
	Accounts receivable decreased $1,283,000 and $200,000 at the U.S. operation and
	TMM, respectively, primarily due to a decrease in fourth quarter sales as
	compared to the same period of 2014.&#160; Accounts receivable at TPT increased $622,000,
	primarily due to an increase in days outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="6%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">

</FONT>

</FONT>
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Inventories
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	:
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Inventories provided cash of $2,246,000 from the end of 2014 to the end of 2015
	due to a reduction in inventory at each of the Company&#8217;s three operating
	segments.&#160; Inventories at the U.S. operation decreased $202,000, TPT decreased
	$238,000 and TMM decreased $1,806,000, primarily related to a reduction in raw
	materials.&#160; Over the next 12 month period, we plan to continue decreasing our
	inventory levels, primarily at TMM, to approximately a three to six month
	level.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>

	$1,376,000 which was related to the payment of expense associated with the
	fourth quarter 2014 SR production; and the U.S. operation decreased $90,000,
	primarily due to timing.&#160; At TPT, accounts payable and accrued expenses

<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
	Operations
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As noted in our critical accounting policies related
	to property, plant and equipment on page 30, we expense routine maintenance and
	repair costs to operations as incurred and major improvements extending the
	asset lives are capitalized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Financing Activities
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During
	the year ended December 31, 2015, financing activities provided $864,000 and
	used cash of $2,270,000 during the year ended December 31, 2014.&#160; Significant
	factors relating to financing activities include the following:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" SIZE="2">
	&#9658;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD COLSPAN="2">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Lines of Credit
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="CENTER">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD>

	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_28">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER28">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER28">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
	Operations
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Liquidity
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Long-term Debt &#8211; Financial Institutions
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	A schedule of our long-term debt to
	financial institutions as of December 31, 2015 and 2014, is included in Note 2
	to the consolidated financial statements on page F-12.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our
	current maturities of long-term debt, as well as other current maturities, will
	be paid with current cash and cash generated from operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	United States Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	U.S.
	Credit Agreement and Term Loan
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December 31, 2010, the Company&#8217;s U.S. operation
	entered into a credit agreement (the &#8220;Agreement&#8221;) with American Bank, N.A. (the &#8220;Lender&#8221;).&#160; The Agreement consisted of a $2 million term loan and a $2 million line of
	credit.&#160; The term loan, which was scheduled to mature on January 1, 2016, was
	paid in full on November 4, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On January 17, 2014, the Company entered into the
	third amendment (the &#8220;Third Amendment&#8221;) to the Agreement with the Lender.&#160;
	Under the terms of the Third Amendment, the Company is required to maintain a
	ratio of cash flow to debt service of 1.0 to 1.0 for the four month period
	ended April 30, 2014, six month period ended June 30, 2014, nine month period
	ended September 30, 2014, and twelve month period ended December 31, 2014.&#160;
	Thereafter, the required ratio of cash flow to debt service shall be 1.25 to
	1.0 measured on a rolling four quarter basis as originally detailed in the
	Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December 30, 2015, the Company entered into the sixth
	amendment (the &#8220;Sixth Amendment&#8221;) to the Agreement with the Lender.&#160; As a result of the Company paying off the term loan
	owed to the Lender, the Company no longer has regularly-scheduled principal and
	interest payments owed under its debt service obligations.&#160; Therefore, the
	Lender replaced the cash flow coverage ratio requirement comparing cash flow to
	debt service obligations with a new financial covenant designed to monitor the
	Company&#8217;s cash-flow and net earnings.&#160; Under the terms of the Sixth Amendment, the
	Company is required to maintain positive net earnings before taxes, interest,
	depreciation, amortization and all other non-cash charges on a rolling
	four-quarter basis.&#160; All other terms of the Agreement remained unchanged.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company was in compliance with all covenants at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Agreement is secured by certain assets of the Company which are located in the
	United States or which arise from the Company&#8217;s operations in the United
	States.&#160; Collateral under the Agreement does not include the Company&#8217;s
	ownership or other interests in TMM and TPT, any assets or operations of either
	TMM or TPT or any proceeds thereof.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	European Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	July 7, 2004, TPT entered into a mortgage loan (the &#8220;First Mortgage&#8221;) with
	Rabobank.&#160; The First Mortgage, in the amount of &#8364;485,000 ($527,000 at
	12/31/2015), is to be repaid over 25 years and the interest rate is to be
	adjusted every five years.&#160; Under the terms of the First Mortgage, the interest
	was adjusted to a fixed rate of 3.85%, effective August 1, 2013, for a period
	of five years.&#160; Thereafter, the rate will change to Rabobank prime plus 1.75%.&#160;
	TPT utilized &#8364;325,000 ($353,000 at 12/31/2015) of the loan to finance the July
	14, 2004, purchase of land and an office building, as well as to remodel the
	office building.&#160; The balance of the loan proceeds, &#8364;160,000 ($174,000 at
	12/31/2015), was used for the expansion of TPT&#8217;s existing building.&#160; Monthly
	principal and interest payments commenced on September 1, 2004, and will
	continue through July 1, 2029.&#160; The monthly principal payment is &#8364;1,616 ($1,756
	at 12/31/2015).&#160; The loan balance at December 31, 2015 was &#8364;217,000 ($235,000 at
	12/31/2015).&#160; The First Mortgage is secured by the land and office building
	purchased on July 7, 2004.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	January 3, 2005, TPT entered into a second mortgage loan (the &#8220;Second
	Mortgage&#8221;) with Rabobank to fund the acquisition of a 10,000 square foot
	warehouse with a loading dock that is located adjacent to TPT&#8217;s existing
	production facility.&#160; The Second Mortgage, in the amount of &#8364;470,000 ($511,000 at
	12/31/2015), is to be repaid over 25 years and the interest rate is to be
	adjusted every five years.&#160; Under the terms of the Second Mortgage, the
	interest was adjusted to a fixed rate of 3.3%, effective January 3, 2013, for a
	period of five years.&#160; Thereafter, the rate will change to Rabobank prime plus
	1.75%.&#160; Monthly principal and interest payments commenced on February 28, 2005
	and will continue through January 31, 2030.&#160; The monthly principal payment is
	&#8364;1,566 ($1,702 at 12/31/2015).&#160; The Second Mortgage is secured by the land and
	building purchased by TPT on January 3, 2005.&#160; The loan balance at December 31,
	2015 was &#8364;243,000 ($264,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER28">

<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	- 28 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<A NAME="eolPage29"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_29">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER29">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER29">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
	Operations
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	July 13, 2015, TPT entered into a third mortgage loan (the &#8220;Third Mortgage&#8221;)
	with Rabobank to fund the completion of its plant expansion.&#160; The Third
	Mortgage, in the amount of &#8364;1,000,000 ($1,087,000 at 12/31/2015), will be
	repaid over 10 years and the interest rate, currently fixed at 3% is to be
	adjusted every five years.&#160; Thereafter, the rate will change to Rabobank prime
	plus 1.75%.&#160; Monthly principal payments of &#8364;8,333 ($9,056) commenced on January
	31, 2016 and continue through December 31, 2025.&#160; The Third Mortgage is secured
	by TPT&#8217;s real estate.&#160; The loan balance at December 31, 2015 was &#8364;1,000,000
	($1,087,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	July 13, 2015, TPT entered into a term loan (the &#8220;Term Loan&#8221;) with Rabobank to
	fund equipment purchases designed to improve production efficiencies and
	increase capacity at TPT.&#160; The Term Loan, in the amount of &#8364;2,350,000
	($2,554,000 at 12/31/2015), will be amortized over a period of 5 years and is
	secured by TPT&#8217;s assets.&#160; The interest rate, set for a period of three months,
	is based on the relevant EURIBOR rate plus the bank margin of 2.3 percentage points
	per annum, and which was 2.184% at December 31, 2015.&#160; The monthly principal
	payment of &#8364;39,167 ($42,567 at 12/31/2015) commenced on January 31, 2016 and
	continues through December 31, 2020.&#160; The loan balance at December 31, 2015 was
	&#8364;2,350,000 ($2,554,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Asian Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	March 2, 2012, our subsidiary, TMM amended their banking facility (the &#8220;HSBC
	Facility&#8221;) with HSBC Bank Malaysia Berhad (&#8220;HSBC&#8221;), a Malaysian Bank, &#160;to
	include a new term loan, funded in Malaysian Ringgits (&#8220;RM&#8221;), in the amount of RM
	3,500,000 ($814,000 at 12/31/2015) for the purpose of upgrading the operation&#8217;s
	SR production process.&#160; Under the terms of the HSBC Facility, the loan will be
	paid in 35 equal monthly installments of RM 97,223 (excluding interest) and a
	final installment of RM97,195 ($22,623 and $22,617, respectively, at 12/31/2015),
	which commenced March 1, 2013 and will continue through March 1, 2016.&#160; The
	interest rate is 2.0% per annum above the HSBC&#8217;s base lending rate, which is
	currently 5.2% per annum and is payable monthly.&#160; The loan balance at December
	31, 2015 was RM 292,000 ($68,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On October 25, 2013, TMM entered into an agreement
	(the &#8220;HSBC Facility Amendment&#8221;) with HSBC to amend the HSBC Facility.&#160; Under
	the terms of the HSBC Facility Amendment, HSBC granted a new term loan to TMM
	in the amount of RM 5,000,000 ($1,163,000
	at 12/31/2015) which was used to finance a
	portion of the cost of plant improvements to increase efficiency and production
	capacity.&#160; Under the terms of the HSBC Facility Amendment, the term loan is
	amortized over a period of five (5) years, and the interest rate is 2.0% per
	annum above the HSBC&#8217;s base lending rate, which is currently 5.2% per annum.&#160; Monthly
	principal payments, in the amount of RM 83,333 ($19,391 at 12/31/2015),
	commenced October 25, 2013 and will continue through October 25, 2018.&#160; The loan balance at December 31, 2015 was RM 3,250,000
	($756,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Short-term Debt
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	U.S. Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December 31, 2010, the Company entered into the
	Agreement with the Lender which established a $1,000,000 line of credit (the
	&#8220;Line&#8221;), and on March 1, 2012, the Line was increased from $1,000,000 to
	$2,000,000.&#160; On May 15, 2013, the Company and the Lender entered into the Second
	Amendment &#160;to the Agreement which reduced the minimum interest rate floor from
	5.5% to 4.5%.&#160; On May 15, 2015, the Company and the Lender entered into the Fifth
	Amendment to the Agreement which extended the Line from October 15, 2015 to
	October 15, 2016.&#160; On December 30, 2015, the Company and the Lender entered
	into the Sixth Amendment to the Agreement.&#160; Under the terms of the Sixth
	Amendment, the Company is required to maintain positive net earnings before
	taxes, interest, depreciation, amortization and all other non-cash charges on a
	rolling four-quarter basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under the terms of the Agreement, as amended, the amount the Company
	is entitled to borrow under the Line is
	subject to a borrowing base, which is based on the loan value of the collateral
	pledged to the Lender to secure the indebtedness owing to the Lender by the
	Company.&#160; Amounts advanced under the Line bear interest at a variable rate
	equal to one percent per annum point above the Wall Street Journal Prime Rate
	as such prime rate changes from time to time, with a minimum floor rate of 4.5%.&#160;
	At December 31, 2015, no funds were outstanding on the Line.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>

<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER29">

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	- 29 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="eolPage30"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_30">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER30">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER30">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
	Operations
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	European Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	July 13, 2015, the TPT Agreement reduced the TPT line from &#8364;1,100,000 to
	&#8364;500,000 ($1,195,000 to $543,000 at 12/31/2015) and interest was changed from a
	variable interest rate of bank prime plus 2.8% to the average 1-month EURIBOR
	plus the bank margin of 3.3%, which was 3.139% at December 31, 2015.&#160; No funds
	were outstanding on the TPT line at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Asian Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	August 24, 2015, TMM amended its short-term banking facility with HSBC to
	extend the maturity date from June 30, 2015 to June 30, 2016.&#160; The HSBC
	facility includes the following in RM:&#160; (1) overdraft of RM 500,000 ($116,000
	at 12/31/2015); (2) an import/export line (&#8220;ECR&#8221;) of RM 10,460,000 ($2,434,000 at
	12/31/2015); and (3) a foreign exchange contract limit of RM 5,000,000 ($1,163,000
	at 12/31/2015).&#160; At December 31, 2015, the outstanding balance on the ECR and
	the foreign exchange contract were RM 4,761,000 ($1,108,000 at 12/31/2015) and
	RM 769,000 ($179,000 at 12/31/2015), respectively, and at a current interest
	rates of 4.96% and 2.506% respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	August 15, 2014, TMM amended its short term banking facility with RHB Bank
	Berhad (&#8220;RHB&#8221;) to extend the maturity date from March 24, 2014 to April 1,
	2015.&#160; TMM is currently negotiating with RHB to extend the maturity date to
	April 21, 2016.&#160; The RHB facility includes the following:&#160; (1) an overdraft
	line of credit up to RM 1,000,000 ($233,000 at 12/31/2015); (2) an ECR of RM
	7,300,000 ($1,700,000 at 12/31/2015); (3) a bank guarantee of RM 1,200,000 ($279,000
	at 12/31/2015); and (4) a foreign exchange contract limit of RM 25,000,000 ($5,817,000
	at 12/31/2015).&#160; At December 31, 2015, no funds were outstanding on the RHB
	facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	banking facilities with both HSBC and RHB bear an interest rate on the
	respective overdraft facilities at 1.25% over bank prime, and the respective
	ECR facilities bear interest at 1.0% above the funding rate stipulated by the
	Export-Import Bank of Malaysia Berhad.&#160; The ECR facilities, which are a
	government supported financing arrangement specifically for exporters, are used
	by TMM for short-term financing of up to 180 days against customers&#8217; and
	inter-company shipments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	borrowings under both the HSBC and the RHB short term credit facilities are
	subject to certain subjective acceleration covenants based on the judgment of
	the banks and a demand provision that provides that the banks may demand
	repayment at any time.&#160; A demand provision is customary in Malaysia for such
	facilities.&#160; The loan agreements are secured by TMM&#8217;s property, plant and
	equipment.&#160; However, if demand is made by HSBC or RHB, we may be unable to
	refinance the demanded indebtedness, in which case, the lenders could foreclose
	on the assets of TMM.&#160; While repatriation is allowed in the form of dividends,
	the credit facilities prohibit TMM from paying dividends, and the HSBC facility
	further prohibits loans to related parties without the prior consent of HSBC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Critical
	Accounting Policies
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Significant Estimates
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211;
	TOR's discussion and analysis of its financial condition and results of
	operations are based upon our consolidated financial statements, which have
	been prepared in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in
	the United States of America.&#160; The preparation of these consolidated financial
	statements requires us to make estimates and judgments that affect the reported
	amounts of assets, liabilities, revenues and expenses, and related disclosure
	of contingent assets and liabilities.&#160; On an on-going basis, we evaluate our
	estimates, including those related to bad debt, inventories, investments,
	intangible assets, income taxes, financing operations &#160;contingencies and
	litigation.&#160; TOR bases its estimates on historical experience and on various
	other assumptions that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances,
	the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying
	values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other
	sources.&#160; Actual results may differ from these estimates under different
	assumptions or conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Revenue Recognition
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; The
	Company recognizes revenue when each of the following four criteria are met:&#160;
	1) a contract or sales arrangement exists; 2) title and risk of loss transfers
	to the customer upon shipment for Free-on-Board (&#8220;FOB&#8221;) shipping point sales or
	when the Company receives confirmation of receipt and acceptance by the
	customer for FOB destination sales; 3) the price of the products is fixed or
	determinable; and 4) collectability is reasonably assured.&#160; The Company does
	not offer any type of discount or allowance to our customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER30">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	- 30 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="eolPage31"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_31">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER31">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER31">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
	Operations
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Depreciation
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; All property, plant and equipment is depreciated using the
	straight-line method over the estimated useful lives of depreciable assets
	which range from 3 to 39 years.&#160; Maintenance and repair costs are charged to
	operations as incurred and major improvements extending asset lives are
	capitalized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Bad Debts
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; We perform
	ongoing credit evaluations of our customers&#8217; financial condition and,
	generally, require no collateral from our customers.&#160; The allowance for
	doubtful accounts is based upon the expected collectability of all accounts
	receivable including review of aging and current economic conditions.&#160; At
	December 31, 2015, we maintained a reserve for doubtful accounts of
	approximately $366,000 and $83,000 at December 31, 2014.&#160; Accounts are written
	off when all reasonable internal and external collection efforts have been
	performed.&#160; If the financial condition of our customers were to deteriorate,
	resulting in an impairment of their ability to make payments, additional
	allowances may be required.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="BACKGROUND:WHITE;FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="BACKGROUND:WHITE;FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; Our effective tax rate is based on our level of
	pre-tax income, statutory rates and tax planning strategies.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160; Significant management judgment is required in
	determining the effective rate and in evaluating our tax position.&#160; At December
	31, 2015, our U.S. operation had federal NOL carry-forwards of approximately $1,217,000
	which resulted in a deferred tax asset (&#8220;DTA&#8221;) of approximately $414,000 which
	will begin to expire in 2033.&#160; We have determined that it is not necessary to
	provide a valuation allowance for our U.S. NOL as we believe the DTA is fully
	recoverable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	At
	December 31, 2015, our Asian operation, TMM, had NOL carry-forwards of approximately
	$3,395,000 and certain other deferred tax assets of approximately $3,445,000
	which resulted in a DTA of approximately $1,700,000.&#160; Due to the uncertainties
	regarding TMM&#8217;s ability to utilize these DTAs, the Company established a
	valuation allowance to fully reserve against these DTAs.&#160; The valuation
	allowance, which was recognized during the fourth quarter of 2015, is included
	in our effective tax rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Inventory
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; We write down
	our inventory for estimated obsolescence or unmarketable inventory equal to the
	difference between the cost of inventory and the estimated market value based
	upon assumptions about future demand and market conditions.&#160; Due to the
	weakness in the TiO2 market, the Company experienced a write down of
	approximately $1,749,000 in inventory, primarily related to HITOX, SR and
	Ilmenite, from cost to estimated market value for the year ended December 31,
	2015. &#160;In addition, we recorded a reserve for obsolescence and unmarketable
	inventory of approximately $826,000 at December 31, 2015.&#160;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Overhead
	is charged to inventory based on normal capacity and we expense abnormal
	amounts of idle facility expense, freight and handling costs in the period
	incurred.&#160; For the year ended December 31, 2015, the Company recorded
	approximately $642,000 related to idle facility expense primarily at the
	Malaysian operations and is included in the Consolidated Statement of
	Operations as a component of &#8220;Cost of sales&#8221;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Property, Plant and Equipment
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; Property, plant and equipment are stated at cost less accumulated
	depreciation.&#160; Depreciation is computed using the straight-line method over the
	estimated useful lives of depreciable assets which range from 3 to 39 years.&#160;
	Maintenance and repair costs are charged to operations as incurred and major
	improvements extending asset lives are capitalized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Impairment of Long-Lived Assets
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; The impairment of tangible and intangible assets is assessed when
	changes in circumstances (such as, but not limited to, a decrease in market
	value of an asset, current and historical operating losses or a change in
	business strategy) indicate that their carrying value may not be recoverable.&#160;
	This assessment is based on management&#8217;s estimates of future undiscounted cash
	flows, salvage values or net sales proceeds.&#160; These estimates take into account
	management&#8217;s expectations and judgments regarding future business and economic
	conditions, future market values and disposal costs.&#160; Actual results and events
	could differ significantly from management&#8217;s estimates.&#160; Based upon our most
	recent analysis, management determined that certain assets at the U.S.
	operation were impaired resulting in an impairment of approximately $35,000.&#160;
	Further, a loss on disposal of assets resulted in a write off of approximately
	$2,900,000 for the year ended December 31, 2015 and is included in the consolidated
	statement of operations as &#8220;Loss on disposal/impairment of asset&#8221;.&#160; There can
	be no assurance that future impairment tests will not result in a charge to net
	earnings (loss).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER31">
</A>
</FONT>

<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	- 31 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
	Operations
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Share Based Compensation
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; We calculate share based compensation using the
	Black-Scholes-Merton (&#8220;Black-Scholes&#8221;) option-pricing model, which requires the
	input of highly subjective assumptions, including the expected stock price
	volatility.&#160; For the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, we recorded $133,000
	and $128,000, respectively, in share-based employee compensation.&#160; This
	compensation cost is included in the general and administrative expenses and
	cost of sales in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Impact of Newly Issued Accounting
	Pronouncements
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Refer to Note 1 to the Consolidated Financial Statements
	under Item 8 of this Annual Report on Form 10-K for a discussion of accounting
	standards that we recently adopted or will be required to adopt.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Off-Balance
	Sheet Arrangements and Contractual Obligations
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Operating
	Leases
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; As of December 31, 2015, we
	lease 13 acres of the land at the facility located in Corpus Christi, Texas,
	from the Port of Corpus Christi Authority and TMM has 38 acres of land which it
	has a commitment to use through 2074.&#160; The minimum future rental payments under
	this and other non-cancelable operating leases as of December 31, 2015 for the
	five years ending December 31 and in total thereafter are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Variable interest rates used
	to calculate interest expense were 2.3% and 5.2% at December 31, 2015.&#160; Refer
	to Note 2 to the consolidated financial statements on page F-12.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We
	had approximately $575,000 in contractual obligations primarily related to open
	purchase orders for capital expenditures at TPT.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
