<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER33">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER33">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of
	Operations
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Except as noted above, we did not have any contractual
	arrangements that have, or are likely to have, a material current or future
	effect on our consolidated financial condition, revenues or expenses, results
	of operations, liquidity, capital expenditures or capital resources.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Other
	Matters
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Anticipated Capital Expenditures
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During 2016, we anticipate capital expenditures of
	approximately $1,000,000 at TPT related to capital maintenance and expansion
	projects.&#160; As noted in our critical accounting policies related to property,
	plant and equipment, we expense routine maintenance and repair costs to
	operations as incurred and major improvements extending the asset lives are
	capitalized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Inflation
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	General
	inflation has not had a significant impact on our business, and it is not
	expected to have a major impact in the foreseeable future.&#160; Increases in energy
	pricing adversely affect our results of operations and are expected to continue
	to do so.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Foreign Operations &#8211; Impact of Exchange Rate
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="BACKGROUND:WHITE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We have two foreign operations, TMM in Malaysia and
	TPT in The Netherlands.&#160; TMM measures and records its transactions in terms of
	the local Malaysian currency, the Ringgit, which is also the functional
	currency.&#160; As a result, gains and losses resulting from translating TMM&#8217;s
	financial statements from Ringgits to U.S. Dollars are recorded as cumulative
	translation adjustments (which are included in accumulated other comprehensive
	income, a separate component of shareholders&#8217; equity) on the consolidated balance
	sheet and statement of comprehensive income (loss).&#160; As of December 31, 2015,
	the cumulative translation adjustment related to the change in functional
	currency to the U.S. Dollar totaled a negative $1,479,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TPT&#8217;s
	functional currency is the Euro.&#160; As a result, gains and losses resulting from
	translating TPT&#8217;s financial statements from Euros to U.S. Dollars are recorded
	as cumulative translation adjustments on the consolidated balance sheet.&#160; As of
	December 31, 2015, the cumulative translation adjustment related to the change
	in functional currency to the U.S. Dollar totaled $97,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Foreign Currency Forward Contracts
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We manage the risk
	of changes in foreign currency exchange rates, primarily at our Malaysian
	operation, through the use of foreign currency contracts.&#160; Foreign exchange
	contracts are used to protect the Company from the risk that the eventual cash
	flows resulting from transactions in foreign currencies, including sales and
	purchases transacted in a currency other than the functional currency, will be
	adversely affected by changes in exchange rates.&#160; We report the fair value of
	the derivatives on our consolidated balance sheet and changes in the fair value
	are recognized in earnings in the period of the change.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="BACKGROUND:WHITE;FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	At December 31, 2015, we had foreign currency contracts not
	designated as hedges.&#160; We marked these contracts to market, recording a net
	loss of approximately $80,000 as a component of our 2015 net loss and $6,000 as
	a current liability on the consolidated balance sheet
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER33">
</A>
</FONT>

	- 33 -
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<DIV ALIGN=LEFT>
<TABLE CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100%;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="10%" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 0PT 0IN 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Item 9 A.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=TOP WIDTH="90%" STYLE="PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_CONTROLS_AND_PROCEDURES_">
	Controls and Procedures
</A>
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Evaluation
	of Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under
	the supervision and with the participation of the Company's Chief Executive
	Officer and Chief Financial Officer, management of the Company has evaluated
	the effectiveness of the design and operation of the Company's disclosure
	controls and procedures (as defined in Rule 13a-15(e) and Rule 15d-15(e) under
	the Securities Exchange Act of 1934) as of the end of the period covered by the
	report (&#8220;Evaluation Date&#8221;).&#160; Based on that evaluation, the Chief Executive
	Officer and Chief Financial Officer concluded that, as of the Evaluation Date,
	the Company's disclosure controls and procedures are effective (i) to ensure
	that information required to be disclosed by us in reports that the Company
	files or submits under the Exchange Act is recorded, processed, summarized and
	reported within the time periods specified in the Securities and Exchange
	Commission rules and forms; and (ii) to ensure that the information required to
	be disclosed in the reports that the Company files or submits under the
	Exchange Act is accumulated and communicated to our management, including the
	Company&#8217;s Chief Executive Officer and Chief Financial Officer, to allow timely
	decisions regarding required disclosures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Management&#8217;s
	Annual Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	management of the Company is responsible for establishing and maintaining
	adequate internal control over financial reporting as defined in Rules
	13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f) under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.&#160;
	The Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting is designed to provide
	reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the
	preparation of financial statements for external purposes in accordance with
	generally accepted accounting principles.&#160; The Company&#8217;s internal control over
	financial reporting includes those policies and procedures that:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<TABLE BORDER="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="6%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	1)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	pertain to the maintenance of
	records that, in reasonable detail, accurately and fairly reflect the
	transactions and dispositions of the assets of the Company;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="6%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	2)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	provide reasonable assurance that
	transactions are recorded as necessary to permit preparation of consolidated financial
	statements in accordance with U.S. generally accepted accounting principles,
	and that receipts and expenditures of the Company are being made only in
	accordance with authorizations of management and directors of the Company; and
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="6%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP: 0; MARGIN-BOTTOM: 0">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	3)
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="84%" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="MARGIN-BOTTOM:0;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;MARGIN-TOP:0">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	provide reasonable assurance
	regarding prevention or timely detection of unauthorized acquisition, use or
	disposition of the Company&#8217;s assets that could have a material effect on the consolidated
	financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Because
	of inherent limitations, internal control over financial reporting may not
	prevent or detect misstatements.&#160; Also, projections of any evaluation of
	effectiveness of future periods are subject to risk that controls may become
	inadequate because of changes in conditions, or that the degree of compliance
	with the policies or procedures may deteriorate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our
	management assessed the effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s internal control over
	financial reporting as of
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	,
	based on criteria established in Internal Control - Integrated Framework issued
	by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission
	(&#8220;COSO&#8221;) (2013 framework). Based on its assessment under that framework and the
	criteria established therein, our management concluded that the Company&#8217;s
	internal control over financial reporting was effective as of
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER34">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	- 34 -
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	This annual report does not include an attestation
	report of the Company&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm regarding
	internal control over financial reporting.&#160; Management&#8217;s report was not subject
	to attestation by the Company&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm
	pursuant to rules of the Securities and Exchange Commission that permit the
	Company to provide only management&#8217;s report in this annual report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Changes
	in Internal Controls
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	During
	the quarter ended December 31, 2015, there were no changes in the Company's
	internal controls over financial reporting (as defined in Rule 13a-15(f) and
	15d-15(f) of the Exchange Act) that have materially affected or are reasonably
	likely to materially affect the Company&#8217;s internal controls over financial
	reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<B>

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company has previously disclosed all items required to be reported on a Form
	8-K for the quarter ended December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
</EFX_PART_II>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Code of Ethics
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company has adopted a Code of Ethics that applies to all of its directors,
	officers (including its chief executive officer, chief financial officer,
	controller and any person performing similar functions) and employees.&#160; The
	Code of Ethics can be viewed on the Company&#8217;s web site at
</FONT>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	www.torminerals.com
</FONT>
</U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.&#160;
	The Company intends to post amendments to, or waivers from, its Code of Ethics
	that apply to its Chief Executive Officer, Chief Financial Officer, Controller
	and any other person performing similar functions, on its website.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company will provide to any person, without charge, upon written request, a
	copy of the Code of Ethics.&#160; Such requests should be sent to the Company&#8217;s
	Corporate Secretary, Barbara Russell, at 722 Burleson Street, Corpus Christi,
	Texas&#160; 78402.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">

<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	February 21, 2000, the Company's Board of Directors approved the adoption of
	the 2000 Incentive Stock Option Plan (the &#8220;Plan&#8221;) for TOR Minerals
	International, Inc.&#160; The Plan provides for the award of a variety of incentive
	compensation arrangements, including restricted stock awards, performance units
	or other non-option awards, to such employees and directors as may be
	determined by a Committee of the Board.&#160; At the Annual Shareholders&#8217; meeting on
	May 11, 2012, the maximum number of shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock that
	may be sold or issued under the Plan was increased to 500,000 shares subject to
	certain adjustments upon recapitalization, stock splits and combinations,
	merger, stock dividend and similar events; in addition the Plan was extended to
	May 23, 2022.&#160; At December 31, 2015, there were 146,305 options outstanding, 114,631
	exercised and 239,064 available for future issuance under the Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, the
	Company recorded $133,000 and $128,000, respectively, in stock-based
	compensation.&#160; This compensation cost is included in the general and
	administrative expenses and cost of sales in the accompanying consolidated
	statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	7.00
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The risk free interest rate is based on the Treasury
	Constant Maturity Rate as quoted by the Federal Reserve at the time of the
	grant for a term equivalent to the expected term of the grant.&#160; The estimated
	volatility is based on the historical volatility of our stock and other
	factors.&#160; The expected term of options represents the period of time the
	options are expected to be outstanding from grant date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The number of shares of common stock underlying options
	exercisable at December 31, 2015 was 110,805 and the weighted-average remaining
	contractual life of those options is 5.08 years.&#160; Exercise prices on options
	outstanding at December 31, 2015, ranged from $2.70 to $19.99 per share as
	noted in the following table.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER43">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12.0PT;">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_REPORT_OF_INDEPENDENT_REGISTERED_PUBLIC_ACCOUNTING_FIRM_">
	Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting
	Firm
</A>
</FONT>
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	To the Board of Directors and Shareholders of
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	TOR Minerals International, Inc.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	We have audited the accompanying consolidated balance
	sheets of TOR Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries (collectively, the &#8220;Company&#8221;)
	as of December 31, 2015 and 2014, and the related consolidated statements of operations,
	comprehensive loss, shareholders&#8217; equity and cash flows for each of the years
	then ended.&#160; These financial statements are the responsibility of the Company&#8217;s
	management.&#160; Our responsibility is to express an opinion on these consolidated
	financial statements based on our audits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	We conducted our audits in accordance with the
	standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States).&#160;
	Those standards require that we plan and perform the audits to obtain
	reasonable assurance about whether the consolidated financial statements are
	free of material misstatement.&#160; The Company is not required to have, nor were
	we engaged to perform, an audit of its internal control over financial
	reporting.&#160; Our audits included consideration of internal control over financial
	reporting as a basis for designing audit procedures that are appropriate in the
	circumstances, but not for the purpose of expressing an opinion on the
	effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s internal control over financial reporting.&#160;
	Accordingly, we express no such opinion.&#160; An audit also includes examining, on
	a test basis, evidence supporting the amounts and disclosures in the
	consolidated financial statements, assessing the accounting principles used and
	significant estimates made by management, as well as evaluating the overall
	consolidated financial statement presentation.&#160; We believe that our audits
	provide a reasonable basis for our opinion.&#160;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	In our opinion, the consolidated financial statements
	referred to above present fairly, in all material respects, the consolidated
	financial position of TOR Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries, at December
	31, 2015 and 2014, and the consolidated results of their operations and their
	cash flows for each of the years then ended in conformity with accounting
	principles generally accepted in the United States of America.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	/s/ BDO USA, LLP
</FONT>
</U>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	BDO USA, LLP
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Houston, Texas
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	March 7, 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

</P>

<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:13.2PT;">
<TD VALIGN=BOTTOM WIDTH=69% STYLE="BACKGROUND:#C5D9F1;HEIGHT:13.2PT;PADDING:0IN .85PT 0IN .85PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-INDENT:10.0PT;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Income taxes paid
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=BOTTOM WIDTH=1% STYLE="BACKGROUND:#C5D9F1;HEIGHT:13.2PT;PADDING:0IN .85PT 0IN .85PT;">

<A NAME="eolPage49"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_49">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER49">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER49">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:8.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN=LEFT>
<TABLE CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100%;">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;">
<TD WIDTH=10% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0PT 0IN 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	1.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_DESCRIPTION_OF_BUSINESS">
	Description of
	Business
</A>
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries (the
	&quot;Company&quot;), a Delaware Corporation, is engaged in a single industry,
	the manufacture and sale of mineral products for use as pigments and extenders,
	primarily in the manufacture of paints, industrial coatings plastics, and solid
	surface applications.&#160; The Company's global headquarters and U.S. manufacturing
	plant are located in Corpus Christi, Texas (&#8220;TOR U.S.&#8221; or &#8220;U.S. Operation&#8221;).&#160;
	The Asian Operation, TOR Minerals Malaysia, Sdn. Bhd. (&#8220;TMM&#8221;), is located in
	Ipoh, Malaysia, and the European Operation, TOR Processing and Trade, BV
	(&#8220;TPT&#8221;), is located in Hattem, The Netherlands.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Basis of Presentation and Use of Estimates:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The consolidated financial statements include accounts
	of TOR Minerals International, Inc. and its wholly-owned subsidiaries, TMM and TPT.&#160;
	All significant intercompany transactions and balances are eliminated in the
	consolidation process.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In
	preparing consolidated financial statements in conformity with accounting
	principles generally accepted in the United States of America, we evaluate our
	estimates, including those related to bad debt, inventories, investments,
	intangible assets, income taxes, financing operations, contingencies and
	litigation.&#160; TOR bases its estimates on historical experience and on various
	other assumptions that are believed to be reasonable under the circumstances,
	the results of which form the basis for making judgments about the carrying
	values of assets and liabilities that are not readily apparent from other
	sources.&#160; Actual results may differ from these estimates under different
	assumptions or conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Cash and Cash Equivalents:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company considers all highly liquid investments readily convertible to known
	cash amounts and with a maturity of twelve months or less at the date of
	purchase to be cash equivalents.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Allowance for Doubtful Accounts:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company performs ongoing credit evaluations of its
	customers' financial condition and, generally, requires no collateral from its
	customers.&#160; The allowance for non-collection of accounts receivable is based
	upon the expected collectability of all accounts receivable including review of
	current aging schedules and current economic conditions and customer history.&#160;
	Accounts are written off when all reasonable internal and external collection
	efforts have been performed.&#160; At December 31, 2015 and 2014, we maintained a
	reserve for doubtful accounts of approximately $366,000 and $83,000,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Foreign Currency:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Results
	of operations for the Company&#8217;s foreign operations, TMM and TPT, are translated
	from the designated functional currency to the U.S. Dollar using average
	exchange rates during the period, while assets and liabilities are translated
	at the exchange rate in effect at the reporting date.&#160; Resulting gains or
	losses from translating foreign currency financial statements are reported as
	other comprehensive income (loss), net of income tax.&#160; The effect of changes in
	exchange rates between the designated functional currency and the currency in
	which a transaction is denominated are recorded as foreign currency transaction
	gains (losses) in earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TMM
	measures and records its transactions in terms of the local Malaysian currency,
	the Ringgit (&#8220;RM&#8221;), which is also the functional currency.&#160; As a result, gains
	and losses resulting from translating the balance sheet from RM to U.S. Dollars
	are recorded as cumulative translation adjustments (which are included in
	accumulated other comprehensive income, a separate component of shareholders&#8217;
	equity) on the consolidated balance sheets.&#160; As of December 31, 2015, the
	cumulative translation adjustment included on the consolidated balance sheets
	totaled negative $1,479,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TPT&#8217;s
	functional currency is the Euro.&#160; As a result, gains and losses resulting from
	translating the balance sheet from Euros to U.S. Dollars are recorded as
	cumulative translation adjustments on the consolidated balance sheets.&#160; As of
	December 31, 2015, the cumulative translation adjustment included on the consolidated
	balance sheets totaled $97,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER49">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	F &#8211;
	8
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="eolPage50"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_50">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER50">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER50">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
<EFX_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT>
<A NAME="FIS_NOTES_TO_FINANCIAL_STATEMENT"></A>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Inventories:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Inventories
	are stated at the lower of cost or market with cost being determined
	principally by use of the average-cost method.&#160; The Company writes down
	inventory for estimated obsolescence or unmarketable inventory equal to the
	difference between the cost of inventory and the estimated market value based
	upon assumptions about future demand and market conditions.&#160; Due to the
	weakness in the titanium dioxide (&#8220;TiO2&#8221;) market, the Company experienced a
	write down of approximately $1,749,000 in inventory, primarily related to HITOX
	and Synthetic Rutile, from the cost to estimated market value for the year
	ended December 31, 2015.&#160; In addition, we maintained a reserve for obsolescence
	and unmarketable inventory of approximately $826,000 and $131,000 at December 31,
	2015 and 2014, respectively.&#160;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Overhead
	is charged to inventory based on normal capacity and we expense abnormal
	amounts of idle facility expense, freight and handling costs in the period
	incurred.&#160; For the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, the Company recorded
	approximately $642,000 and $847,000, respectively, related to idle facility
	expense primarily at the Malaysian operations and is included in the
	Consolidated Statement of Operations as a component of &#8220;Cost of sales&#8221;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Property, Plant and Equipment:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Property, plant and equipment are stated at cost less accumulated
	depreciation.&#160; Depreciation is computed using the straight-line method over the
	estimated useful lives of depreciable assets which range from 3 to 39 years.&#160; Maintenance
	and repair costs are charged to operations as incurred and major improvements
	extending asset lives are capitalized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Impairment of Long-Lived Assets:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The impairment of tangible and intangible assets is
	assessed when changes in circumstances (such as, but not limited to, a decrease
	in market value of an asset, current and historical operating losses or a
	change in business strategy) indicate that their carrying value may not be
	recoverable.&#160; This assessment is based on management&#8217;s estimates of future
	undiscounted cash flows, salvage values or net sales proceeds.&#160; These estimates
	take into account management&#8217;s expectations and judgments regarding future business
	and economic conditions, future market values and disposal costs.&#160; Actual
	results and events could differ significantly from management&#8217;s estimates.&#160;
	Based upon our most recent analysis, management determined that certain assets
	at the U.S. operation were impaired resulting in an impairment of approximately
	$35,000.&#160; Further, a loss on disposal of assets resulted in a write off of approximately
	$2,900,000 for the year ended December 31, 2015 and $2,140,000 for the year
	ended December 31, 2014, which is included in the consolidated statement of
	operations as &#8220;Loss on disposal/impairment of asset&#8221;.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Revenue Recognition:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company recognizes revenue when each of the following four criteria are met:&#160;
	1) a contract or sales arrangement exists; 2) title and risk of loss transfers
	to the customer upon shipment for FOB shipping point sales or when the Company
	receives confirmation of receipt and acceptance by the customer for FOB
	destination sales; 3) the price of the products is fixed or determinable; and
	4) collectability is reasonably assured.&#160; The Company does not offer any type
	of discount or allowance to our customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Shipping and Handling:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company records shipping and handling costs, associated with the outbound
	freight on products shipped to customers, as a component of cost of goods sold.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Earnings Per Share:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Basic
	earnings per share are based on the weighted average number of shares
	outstanding and exclude any dilutive effects of options, warrants, debentures
	and/or convertible preferred stock.&#160; Diluted earnings per share reflect the
	effect of all dilutive items.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Income Taxes:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company records income taxes using the liability method.&#160; Under this method,
	deferred income tax assets and liabilities are determined based on differences
	between financial reporting and tax bases of assets and liabilities and are
	measured using the enacted tax rates and laws that will be in effect when the
	differences are expected to reverse.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	When accounting for uncertainties in income taxes, we
	evaluate all tax years still subject to potential audit under the applicable
	state, federal and foreign income tax laws.&#160; We are subject to taxation in the
	United States, Malaysia and The Netherlands.&#160; Our federal income tax returns in
	the United States are subject to examination for the tax years ended December
	31, 2012 through December 31, 2015.&#160; Our state tax return, which is filed in
	Texas, is subject to examination for the tax years ended December 31, 2011 through
	December 31, 2015.&#160; Our tax returns in various non-U.S. jurisdictions are
	subject to examination for various tax years dating back to December 31, 2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER50">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	F &#8211;
	9
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage51"></A>

	&nbsp;

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_51">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER51">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER51">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	As of January 1, 2015, we
	did not have any unrecognized tax benefits and there was no change during the year
	ended December 31, 2015.&#160; In addition, we did not recognize any interest and
	penalties in our consolidated financial statements during the year ended
	December 31, 2015.&#160; If any interest or penalties related to any income tax
	liabilities are imposed in future reporting periods, we expect to record both
	of these items as components of income tax expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Share Based Compensation:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company calculates share based compensation using the Black-Scholes-Merton
	(&#8220;Black-Scholes&#8221;) option-pricing model, which requires the input of subjective
	assumptions including the expected stock price volatility.&#160; For the years ended
	December 31, 2015 and 2014, we recorded $133,000 and $128,000, respectively, in
	share-based employee compensation.&#160; This compensation cost is included in the
	general and administrative expenses and cost of sales in the accompanying
	consolidated statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Derivatives:&#160;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We manage
	the risk of changes in foreign currency exchange rates, primarily at our
	Malaysian operation, through the use of foreign currency contracts.&#160; Foreign
	exchange contracts are used to protect the Company from the risk that the
	eventual cash flows resulting from transactions in foreign currencies,
	including sales and purchases transacted in a currency other than the
	functional currency, will be adversely affected by changes in exchange rates.&#160;
	We report the fair value of the derivatives on our consolidated balance sheets
	and changes in the fair value are recognized in earnings in the period of the
	change.
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160;(See Note 14, Derivatives and Other Financial Instruments).
</FONT>
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Reclassifications:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160;
	Certain reclassifications have been made to the prior year&#8217;s consolidated
	balance sheet to conform to the current year presentation.&#160; These
	reclassifications had no effect on the consolidated financial position, results
	of operations or cash flows of the Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	New Accounting Standards
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:12.0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<EM>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;FONT-STYLE:NORMAL;">
	In February 2016, the
	FASB issued Accounting Standards Update No. 2016-02, Leases. The new standard
	requires a lessor to classify leases as either sales-type, finance or
	operating.&nbsp; A lease will be treated as a sale if it transfers all of the
	risks and rewards, as well as control of the underlying asset, to the lessee.
	If risks and rewards are conveyed without the transfer of control, the lease is
	treated as a financing.&nbsp; If the lessor doesn&#8217;t convey risks and rewards or
	control, an operating lease results.&#160; The new standard is effective for fiscal
	years beginning after December 15, 2018, including interim periods within those
	fiscal years. A modified retrospective transition approach is required for
	lessors for sales-type, direct financing, and operating leases existing at, or
	entered into after, the beginning of the earliest comparative period presented
	in the financial statements, with certain practical expedients available.&#160; We
	are currently evaluating the impact of our pending adoption of the new standard
	on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</EM>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In
	November 2015, the FASB issued ASU No. 2015-17,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Income Taxes (Topic 740):
	Balance Sheet Classification of Deferred Taxes
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	, which requires that all
	deferred tax assets and liabilities, along with any related valuation
	allowance, be classified as noncurrent in the balance sheet on a net basis. As
	a result, each jurisdiction will now only have one net noncurrent deferred tax
	asset or liability. However, the new guidance does not change the existing
	requirement that only permits offsetting within a jurisdiction. Companies are
	still prohibited from offsetting deferred tax liabilities from one jurisdiction
	against deferred tax assets of another jurisdiction. The amendments in this
	accounting standard are effective for public companies for interim and annual
	reporting periods beginning after December 15, 2016, with early application
	permitted. The Company has applied the change in accounting as of December 31,
	2015. As such, the amounts previously reported in the consolidated balance
	sheet as of December 31, 2014 have been reclassified for consistent
	presentation.&#160; The domestic current deferred tax assets and noncurrent deferred
	tax liabilities of $37,000 and $618,000, respectively, were restated and are reported
	as a domestic deferred tax liability of $581,000 and the foreign current
	deferred tax assets and noncurrent deferred tax assets were restated and are
	reported as a noncurrent deferred tax asset of $716,000.&#160; The change in accounting
	principle does not have an impact on the Company&#8217;s results of operations, cash
	flows or stockholders&#8217; equity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER51">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	F &#8211;
	10
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<HR NOSHADE ALIGN="CENTER" WIDTH="100%" SIZE=2>
<A NAME="eolPage52"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_52">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER52">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER52">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In July
	2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-11,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Simplifying the Measurement of Inventory
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(&quot;ASU
	2015-11&quot;). ASU 2015-11 applies to inventory that is measured using the
	FIFO or average cost method and requires measurement of that inventory at the
	lower of cost and net realizable value. Net realizable value is the estimated
	selling prices in the ordinary course of business, less reasonably predictable
	costs of completion, disposal and transportation. This ASU is effective for
	fiscal years, and interim periods within those years, beginning after December
	15, 2016. Early adoption is permitted.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We
	do not expect that the adoption of this pronouncement will have a material
	effect on our
	consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In April 2015, the FASB issued ASU
	2015-03,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Interest - Imputation of Interest (Subtopic 835-30): Simplifying
	the Presentation of Debt Issuance Costs
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(&quot;ASU 2015-03&quot;). ASU
	2015-03 requires debt issuance costs related to a recognized debt liability be
	presented in the balance sheet as a direct deduction from the carrying value of
	that debt liability, consistent with debt discounts. The recognition and
	measurement guidance for debt issuance costs are not affected by ASU 2015-03.
	The amendments in ASU 2015-03 require retrospective application and represent a
	change in accounting principle.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	adoption of this pronouncement did not have a material effect on our consolidated
	financial position, results of operations or cash flows
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In August 2014, the FASB issued ASU 2014-15,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Presentation
	of Financial Statements&#8212;Going Concern: Disclosure of Uncertainties about an
	Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	, which requires the
	management of the Company to evaluate whether there is substantial doubt about
	the Company's ability to continue as a going concern. ASU 2014-15 is effective
	for annual periods ending after December 15, 2016. While early adoption is
	permitted, we do not plan to early adopt this guidance. We do not expect that the adoption of this
	pronouncement will have a material effect on our consolidated financial position, results of
	operations or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	In May 2014, the FASB issued ASU
	2014-09,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Revenue from Contracts with Customers
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(&quot;ASU 2014-09&quot;)
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	ASU 2014-09 supersedes the revenue recognition requirements of FASB
	Accounting Standards Codification (&quot;ASC&quot;) Topic 605,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Revenue
	Recognition
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	and most industry-specific guidance throughout the ASC,
	resulting in the creation of FASB ASC Topic 606,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Revenue from Contracts with
	Customers
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	. ASU 2014-09 requires entities to recognize revenue in a way that
	depicts the transfer of promised goods or services to customers in an amount
	that reflects the consideration to which the entity expects to be entitled to
	in exchange for those goods or services.&nbsp;This ASU provides alternative
	methods of adoption. In August 2015, the FASB issued ASU 2015-14,
</FONT>
<I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Revenue
	from Contracts with Customers, Deferral of the Effective Date
</FONT>
</I>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	(&quot;ASU
	2015-14&quot;). ASU 2015-14 defers the effective date of ASU 2014-09 by one
	year to December 15, 2017 for fiscal years, and interim periods within those
	years, beginning after that date and permits early adoption of the standards,
	but not before original effective date for fiscal years beginning after
	December 15, 2016.
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160;We are still
	evaluating the effect on
	our consolidated financial position, results of operations or cash flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER52">
</A>
</FONT>

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	F &#8211; 11
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN=BOTTOM WIDTH=13% STYLE="BACKGROUND:WHITE;HEIGHT:.2IN;PADDING:0IN .85PT 0IN .85PT;">
<P ALIGN=RIGHT STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:.7PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	417&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:.2IN;">
<TD VALIGN=BOTTOM WIDTH=66% STYLE="BACKGROUND:#C5D9F1;HEIGHT:.2IN;PADDING:0IN .85PT 0IN .85PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Malaysian
	Ringgit term note payable to a Malaysian bank, with an interest rate 2% above
	the bank base lending rate, which was 5.2% at December 31, 2015, due October
	25, 2018, secured by TMM's property, plant and equipment. (Balance in Ringgit
	at December 31, 2015, RM 3,250)
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN=BOTTOM WIDTH=4% STYLE="BACKGROUND:#C5D9F1;HEIGHT:.2IN;PADDING:0IN .85PT 0IN .85PT;">
<P ALIGN=RIGHT STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:RIGHT;">

<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE: ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</DIV>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_54">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER54">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER54">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	United States Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	U.S.
	Credit Agreement and Term Loan
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December 31, 2010, the Company&#8217;s U.S. operation
	entered into a credit agreement (the &#8220;Agreement&#8221;) with American Bank, N.A. (the &#8220;Lender&#8221;).&#160; The Agreement consisted of a $2 million term loan and a $2 million line of
	credit.&#160; The term loan, which was scheduled to mature on January 1, 2016, was
	paid in full on November 4, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On January 17, 2014, the Company entered into the
	third amendment (the &#8220;Third Amendment&#8221;) to the Agreement with the Lender.&#160;
	Under the terms of the Third Amendment, the Company is required to maintain a
	ratio of cash flow to debt service of 1.0 to 1.0 for the four month period
	ended April 30, 2014, six month period ended June 30, 2014, nine month period
	ended September 30, 2014, and twelve month period ended December 31, 2014.&#160; Thereafter,
	the required ratio of cash flow to debt service shall be 1.25 to 1.0 measured
	on a rolling four quarter basis as originally detailed in the Agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	December 30, 2015, the Company entered into the sixth amendment (the &#8220;Sixth
	Amendment&#8221;) to the Agreement with the Lender.&#160; As a result of the Company
	paying off the term loan owed to the Lender, the Company no longer has
	regularly-scheduled principal and interest payments owed under its debt service
	obligations.&#160; Therefore, the Lender replaced the cash flow coverage ratio
	requirement comparing cash flow to debt service obligations with a new
	financial covenant designed to monitor the Company&#8217;s cash-flow and net
	earnings.&#160; Under the terms of the Sixth Amendment, the Company is required to
	maintain positive net earnings before taxes, interest, depreciation,
	amortization and all other non-cash charges on a rolling four-quarter basis.&#160;
	All other terms of the Agreement remained unchanged.&#160; The Company was in
	compliance with all covenants at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Agreement is secured by certain assets of the Company which are located in the
	United States or which arise from the Company&#8217;s operations in the United
	States.&#160; Collateral under the Agreement does not include the Company&#8217;s
	ownership or other interests in TMM and TPT, any assets or operations of either
	TMM or TPT or any proceeds thereof.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	European Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	July 7, 2004, TPT entered into a mortgage loan (the &#8220;First Mortgage&#8221;) with
	Rabobank.&#160; The First Mortgage, in the amount of &#8364;485,000 ($527,000 at
	12/31/2015), is to be repaid over 25 years and the interest rate is to be
	adjusted every five years.&#160; Under the terms of the First Mortgage, the interest
	was adjusted to a fixed rate of 3.85%, effective August 1, 2013, for a period
	of five years.&#160; Thereafter, the rate will change to Rabobank prime plus 1.75%.&#160;
	TPT utilized &#8364;325,000 ($353,000 at 12/31/2015) of the loan to finance the July
	14, 2004, purchase of land and an office building, as well as to remodel the
	office building.&#160; The balance of the loan proceeds, &#8364;160,000 ($174,000 at
	12/31/2015), was used for the expansion of TPT&#8217;s existing building.&#160; Monthly
	principal and interest payments commenced on September 1, 2004, and will
	continue through July 1, 2029.&#160; The monthly principal payment is &#8364;1,616 ($1,756
	at 12/31/2015).&#160; The loan balance at December 31, 2015 was &#8364;217,000 ($235,000
	at 12/31/2015).&#160; The First Mortgage is secured by the land and office building
	purchased on July 7, 2004.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	January 3, 2005, TPT entered into a second mortgage loan (the &#8220;Second
	Mortgage&#8221;) with Rabobank to fund the acquisition of a 10,000 square foot
	warehouse with a loading dock that is located adjacent to TPT&#8217;s existing
	production facility.&#160; The Second Mortgage, in the amount of &#8364;470,000 ($511,000
	at 12/31/2015), is to be repaid over 25 years and the interest rate is to be
	adjusted every five years.&#160; Under the terms of the Second Mortgage, the
	interest was adjusted to a fixed rate of 3.3%, effective January 3, 2013, for a
	period of five years.&#160; Thereafter, the rate will change to Rabobank prime plus
	1.75%.&#160; Monthly principal and interest payments commenced on February 28, 2005
	and will continue through January 31, 2030.&#160; The monthly principal payment is
	&#8364;1,566 ($1,702 at 12/31/2015).&#160; The Second Mortgage is secured by the land and
	building purchased by TPT on January 3, 2005.&#160; The loan balance at December 31,
	2015 was &#8364;243,000 ($264,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	July 13, 2015, TPT entered into a third mortgage loan (the &#8220;Third Mortgage&#8221;)
	with Rabobank to fund the completion of its plant expansion.&#160; The Third
	Mortgage, in the amount of &#8364;1,000,000 ($1,087,000 at 12/31/2015), will be
	repaid over 10 years and the interest rate, currently fixed at 3% is to be
	adjusted every five years.&#160; Thereafter, the rate will change to Rabobank prime
	plus 1.75%.&#160; Monthly principal payments of &#8364;8,333 ($9,056 at 12/31/2015)
	commenced on January 31, 2016 and continue through December 31, 2025.&#160; The
	Third Mortgage is secured by TPT&#8217;s real estate.&#160; The loan balance at December
	31, 2015 was &#8364;1,000,000 ($1,087,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:0IN;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER54">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	F &#8211; 13
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
