<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER55">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On July 13, 2015, TPT entered into a term loan (the
	&#8220;Term Loan&#8221;) with Rabobank to fund equipment purchases designed to improve
	production efficiencies and increase capacity at TPT.&#160; The Term Loan, in the
	amount of &#8364;2,350,000 ($2,554,000 at 12/31/2015), will be amortized over a
	period of 5 years and is secured by TPT&#8217;s assets.&#160; The interest rate, set for a
	period of three months, is based on the relevant EURIBOR rate plus the bank
	margin of 2.3 percentage point per annum, which was 2.184% at December 31,
	2015.&#160; The monthly principal payment of &#8364;39,167 ($42,567 at 12/31/2015) commenced
	on January 31, 2016 and continues through December 31, 2020.&#160; The loan balance
	at December 31, 2015 was &#8364;2,350,000 ($2,554,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Asian Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	March 2, 2012, our subsidiary, TMM amended their banking facility (the &#8220;HSBC
	Facility&#8221;) with HSBC Bank Malaysia Berhad (&#8220;HSBC&#8221;), a Malaysian Bank,&#160; to
	include a new term loan, funded in Malaysian Ringgits (&#8220;RM&#8221;), in the amount of
	RM 3,500,000 ($814,000 at 12/31/2015) for the purpose of upgrading the
	operation&#8217;s SR production process.&#160; Under the terms of the HSBC Facility, the
	loan will be paid in 35 equal monthly installments of RM97,223 (excluding
	interest) and a final installment of RM97,195 ($22,623 and $22,617,
	respectively, at 12/31/2015), which commenced March 1, 2013 and will continue
	through March 1, 2016.&#160; The interest rate is 2.0% per annum above the HSBC&#8217;s
	base lending rate, which is currently 5.2% per annum and is payable monthly.&#160;
	The loan balance at December 31, 2015 was RM 292,000 ($68,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On October 25, 2013, TMM entered into an agreement
	(the &#8220;HSBC Facility Amendment&#8221;) with HSBC to amend the HSBC Facility.&#160; Under
	the terms of the HSBC Facility Amendment, HSBC granted a new term loan to TMM
	in the amount of RM 5,000,000 ($1,163,000
	at 12/31/2015) which was used to finance
	a portion of the cost of plant improvements to increase efficiency and
	production capacity.&#160; Under the terms of the HSBC Facility Amendment, the term
	loan is amortized over a period of five (5) years, and the interest rate is
	2.0% per annum above the HSBC&#8217;s base lending rate, which is currently 5.2% per
	annum.&#160; Monthly principal payments, in the amount of RM 83,333 ($19,391 at 12/31/2015),
	commenced October 25, 2013 and will continue through October 25, 2018.&#160; The loan balance at December 31, 2015 was RM 3,250,000
	($756,000 at 12/31/2015).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company was in compliance with all covenants at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Short-term Debt
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	U.S. Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On December 31, 2010, the Company entered into the
	Agreement with the Lender which established a $1,000,000 line of credit (the
	&#8220;Line&#8221;), and on March 1, 2012, the Line was increased from $1,000,000 to
	$2,000,000.&#160; On May 15, 2013, the Company and the Lender entered into the
	Second Amendment to the Agreement which reduced the minimum interest rate floor
	from 5.5% to 4.5%.&#160; On May 15, 2015, the Company and the Lender entered into
	the Fifth Amendment to the Agreement which extended the Line from October 15,
	2015 to October 15, 2016.&#160; On December 30, 2015, the Company and the Lender
	entered into the Sixth Amendment to the Agreement.&#160; Under the terms of the Sixth
	Amendment, the Company is required to maintain positive net earnings before
	taxes, interest, depreciation, amortization and all other non-cash charges on a
	rolling four-quarter basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Under the terms of the Agreement, as amended, the amount the Company
	is entitled to borrow under the Line is
	subject to a borrowing base, which is based on the loan value of the collateral
	pledged to the Lender to secure the indebtedness owing to the Lender by the
	Company.&#160; Amounts advanced under the Line bear interest at a variable rate
	equal to one percent per annum point above the Wall Street Journal Prime Rate
	as such prime rate changes from time to time, with a minimum floor rate of
	4.5%.&#160; At December 31, 2015, no funds were outstanding on the Line.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	European Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	July 13, 2015, the TPT Agreement reduced the TPT line from &#8364;1,100,000 to
	&#8364;500,000 ($1,195,000 to $543,000 at 12/31/2015) and interest was changed from a
	variable interest rate of bank prime plus 2.8% to the average 1-month EURIBOR
	plus the bank margin of 3.3%, which was 3.139% at December 31, 2015.&#160; No funds
	were outstanding on the TPT line at December 31, 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER56">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Asian Operations
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	August 24, 2015, TMM amended its short-term banking facility with HSBC to
	extend the maturity date from June 30, 2015 to June 30, 2016.&#160; The HSBC
	facility includes the following in RM:&#160; (1) overdraft of RM 500,000 ($116,000
	at 12/31/2015); (2) an import/export line (&#8220;ECR&#8221;) of RM 10,460,000 ($2,434,000
	at 12/31/2015); and (3) a foreign exchange contract limit of RM 5,000,000 ($1,163,000
	at 12/31/2015).&#160; At December 31, 2015, the outstanding balance on the ECR and
	the foreign exchange contract were RM 4,761,000 ($1,108,000 at 12/31/2015) and
	RM 769,000 ($179,000 at 12/31/2015), respectively, and at a current interest
	rates of 4.96% and 2.506% respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	August 15, 2014, TMM amended its short term banking facility with RHB Bank
	Berhad (&#8220;RHB&#8221;) to extend the maturity date from March 24, 2014 to April 1,
	2015.&#160; TMM is currently negotiating with RHB to extend the maturity date to
	April 21, 2016.&#160; The RHB facility includes the following:&#160; (1) an overdraft
	line of credit up to RM 1,000,000 ($233,000 at 12/31/2015); (2) an ECR of RM
	7,300,000 ($1,700,000 at 12/31/2015); (3) a bank guarantee of RM 1,200,000 ($279,000
	at 12/31/2015); and (4) a foreign exchange contract limit of RM 25,000,000 ($5,817,000
	at 12/31/2015).&#160; At December 31, 2015, no funds were outstanding on the RHB
	facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	banking facilities with both HSBC and RHB bear an interest rate on the
	respective overdraft facilities at 1.25% over bank prime, and the respective
	ECR facilities bear interest at 1.0% above the funding rate stipulated by the
	Export-Import Bank of Malaysia Berhad.&#160; The ECR facilities, which are a
	government supported financing arrangement specifically for exporters, are used
	by TMM for short-term financing of up to 180 days against customers&#8217; and
	inter-company shipments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	borrowings under both the HSBC and the RHB short term credit facilities are
	subject to certain subjective acceleration covenants based on the judgment of
	the banks and a demand provision that provides that the banks may demand
	repayment at any time.&#160; A demand provision is customary in Malaysia for such
	facilities.&#160; The loan agreements are secured by TMM&#8217;s property, plant and
	equipment.&#160; However, if demand is made by HSBC or RHB, we may be unable to
	refinance the demanded indebtedness, in which case, the lenders could foreclose
	on the assets of TMM.&#160; While repatriation is allowed in the form of dividends,
	the credit facilities prohibit TMM from paying dividends, and the HSBC facility
	further prohibits loans to related parties without the prior consent of HSBC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	following is a summary of the future maturities of long-term debt to financial
	institutions as of December 31, 2015:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:13.2PT;">

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM_PAGE_57">
</A>
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER57">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER57">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:12.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ALIGN=LEFT>
<TABLE CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100%;">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;">
<TD WIDTH=10% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0PT 0IN 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	3.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Fair Value
	Measurements
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	following table summarizes the valuation of our financial instruments recorded
	on a fair value basis as of December 31, 2015 and 2014.&#160; The Company did not
	hold any non-financial assets and/or non-financial liabilities subject to fair
	value measurements on a recurring basis at December 31, 2015 or 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	fair value measurements consist of the following three levels:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Level 1 inputs:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160; Level 1
	inputs
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	are quoted prices
	(unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities that are
	accessible at the measurement date (e
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	g
</FONT>
<B>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	.,
</FONT>
</B>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	equity securities
	traded on the New York Stock Exchange).
</FONT>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Level 2 inputs:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Level 2 inputs are other than quoted
	prices included in Level 1 that are observable for the asset or liability,
	either directly or indirectly (e. g., quoted prices of similar assets or
	liabilities in active markets, or quoted prices for identical or similar assets
	or liabilities in markets that are not active).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Level 3 inputs:
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT COLOR=BLACK FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Level 3 inputs are unobservable inputs (e.
	g., a company&#8217;s own data) for the asset or liability and should be used to
	measure fair value to the extent that relevant observable inputs are not
	available.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_24"></A>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our
	foreign currency derivative financial instruments mitigate foreign currency exchange
	risks and include forward contracts.&#160; The forward contracts are
	marked-to-market at each balance sheet date with any resulting gain or loss
	recognized in income as part of the gain or loss on foreign currency exchange
	rate included under &#8220;Other Expense&#8221; on the Company&#8217;s consolidated statement of
	operations.&#160; The fair value of the currency forward contracts is determined
	using Level 2 inputs based on the currency rate in effect at the end of the
	reporting period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	fair value of the Company&#8217;s debt is based on estimates using standard pricing
	models and Level 2 inputs, including the Company&#8217;s estimated borrowing rate, that
	take into account the present value of future cash flows as of the consolidated
	balance sheet date.&#160; The computation of the fair value of these instruments is
	performed by the Company.&#160; The carrying amounts and estimated fair values of
	the Company&#8217;s long-term debt, including current maturities, are summarized
	below:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	The
	carrying amounts reported in the consolidated balance sheets for cash and cash
	equivalents, trade receivables, payables and accrued liabilities, accrued
	income taxes and short-term borrowings approximate fair values due to the short
	term nature of these instruments, accordingly, these items have been excluded
	from the above table.

	The
	amounts of depreciation expense calculated on the Company&#8217;s property, plant and
	equipment for the year ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 was $2,863,000 and $3,445,000,
	respectively.&#160;

<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLPAGEBORDER59">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; PADDING-RIGHT: 0%; PADDING-LEFT: 0%">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLHEADER59">
</A>
</FONT>
<DIV>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	TOR
	Minerals International, Inc. and Subsidiaries
<BR>
	Notes to the Consolidated Financial Statements
<BR>
	December 31, 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="BORDER:NONE;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID WINDOWTEXT 1.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0IN 1.0PT 0IN;">
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="BORDER:NONE;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;PADDING:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:4.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV ALIGN=LEFT>
<TABLE CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100%;">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;">
<TD WIDTH=10% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0PT 0IN 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	6.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Segment
	Information
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company and its subsidiaries operate in the business of pigment manufacturing
	and related products in three geographic segments &#8211; United States, European and
	Asian.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	United States
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; This
	segment represents products manufactured at our facility located in Corpus
	Christi, Texas.&#160; The segment manufactures HITOX, BARTEX, HALTEX, OPTILOAD and TIOPREM
	which is sold primarily in North, Central and South America.&#160; Sales of this
	segment, which includes intercompany purchases of ALUPREM from our European operation,
	represented approximately 69% and 68% of our consolidated sales for the years
	ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	European
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; This segment
	represents products manufactured at the Company&#8217;s wholly-owned operation, TPT,
	located in the Netherlands.&#160; TPT manufactures ALUPREM and BARYPREM which is
	sold primarily in Europe.&#160; Sales of this segment, which include intercompany
	purchases HITOX and TIOPREM from our Asian operation, represented approximately
	23% and 22% of our consolidated sales for the years ended December 31, 2015 and
	2014, respectively.&#160; Intercompany sales of ALUPREM between the TPT and the U.S.
	operation are eliminated in consolidation represented 33% and 44% of this
	segments total sales for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Asian
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&#8211; This segment
	represents products manufactured at the Company&#8217;s wholly-owned operation, TMM,
	located in Malaysia.&#160; TMM manufactures HITOX and TIOPREM which is sold
	primarily in Asia.&#160; Sales of this segment represented approximately 8% and 10%
	of our consolidated sales for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014,
	respectively.&#160; Intercompany sales of HITOX, TIOPREM and SR between the TMM and
	the U.S. and European operations are eliminated in consolidation represented
	68% and 61% of this segments total sales for the years ended December 31, 2015
	and 2014, respectively .
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	accounting policies of the segments are the same as those described in the
	Summary of Significant Policies (See Note 1).&#160; Product sales of inventory
	between the U.S., European and Asian operations are based on inter-company
	pricing, which includes an inter-company profit margin.&#160; The segment profit
	(loss),included in the table below, from each location is reflective of these
	inter-company prices, as is inventory at the Corpus Christi location prior to
	elimination adjustments.&#160; Such presentation is consistent with the internal
	reporting reviewed by the Company&#8217;s chief operating decision maker.&#160; The
	elimination entries include an adjustment to the cost of sales resulting from
	the adjustment to ending inventory to eliminate inter-company profit, and the
	reversal of a similar adjustment from a prior period.&#160; To the extent there are
	net increases/declines period over period in Corpus Christi inventories that
	include an inter-company component, the net effect of these adjustments can
	decrease/increase location profit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Our chief operating decision maker, or CODM, regularly
	reviews financial information about our segments in order to allocate resources
	and evaluate performance.&#160; Our CODM assesses segment performance based on
	Segment sales and Segment Adjusted EBITDA which we define as net income (loss)
	before depreciation and amortization, interest expense, bad debt expense,
	foreign currency gains and losses, income taxes, and other items which
	management does not believe reflect the underlying performance of the segment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015, the U.S.
	operations received approximately 25% of its total third party sales revenue
	from a single customer.&#160; The European operations received approximately 28% of
	its total third party sales revenue from two customers (16% and 12%), and the
	Asian operations received approximately 34% of its total third party sales
	revenue from three customers customer (12%, 11% and 11%).&#160; For the year ended
	December 31, 2014, the U.S. operations received approximately 34% of its total
	third party sales revenue from a single customer.&#160; The European operations
	received approximately 33% of its total third party sales revenue from two
	customers (17% and 16%), and the Asian operations received approximately 25% of
	its total third party sales revenue from a single customer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Sales from the subsidiary to the parent company are
	based upon profit margins which represent competitive pricing of similar
	products.&#160; Intercompany sales consisted of ALUPREM, SR, HITOX and TIOPREM.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company's principal products, ALUPREM and HITOX,
	accounted for approximately 36% and 28%, respectively, of net consolidated
	sales in 2015 and approximately 39% and 28%, respectively in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:NORMAL;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN;MARGIN-LEFT:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:0IN;MARGIN-TOP:0IN;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company sells its products to customers located in more than 60 countries.&#160;
	Sales to external customers are attributed to geographic area based on country
	of distribution.&#160; Sales to customers located in the U.S. represented approximately
	59% and 58% for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER59">
</A>
</FONT>

	F &#8211; 18
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">

<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For
	the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, 528,304 detachable warrants (the
	&#8220;Warrants&#8221;), which have an exercise price of $2.65 and a maturity date of May
	4, 2016, were excluded from the calculation of diluted earnings per share as
	the effect would be anti-dilutive.&#160; The Warrants were issued in May 2009 with
	our six percent (6%) convertible subordinated debentures.&#160; The debentures were
	converted to common stock on May 4, 2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For
	the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, approximately 146,300 and 147,700,
	respectively, employee stock options were excluded from calculation of diluted
	earnings per share as the effect would be anti-dilutive.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">

	December 31, 2015 and 2014

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<DIV ALIGN=LEFT>
<TABLE CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100%;">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;">
<TD WIDTH=10% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0PT 0IN 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	9.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Income Taxes
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company provides for deferred taxes on temporary differences between the
	financial statements and tax bases of assets using the enacted tax rates that
	are expected to apply to taxable income when the temporary differences are
	expected to reverse.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	At
	December 31, 2015, our U.S. operation had federal NOL carry-forwards of
	approximately $1,217,000 which resulted in a deferred tax asset (&#8220;DTA&#8221;) of
	approximately $414,000 which will begin to expire in 2033.&#160; We have determined
	that it is not necessary to provide a valuation allowance for our U.S. NOL as
	we believe the DTA is fully recoverable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	At
	December 31, 2015, our Asian operation, TMM, had NOL carry-forwards of approximately
	$3,395,000 and certain other deferred tax assets of approximately $3,445,000
	which resulted in a DTA of approximately $1,700,000.&#160; Due to the uncertainties
	regarding TMM&#8217;s ability to utilize these DTAs, the Company established a
	valuation allowance to fully reserve against these DTAs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	undistributed earnings of the Company&#8217;s foreign subsidiaries are considered to
	be indefinitely reinvested.&#160; Accordingly, no provision for U.S. federal and
	state income taxes or foreign withholding taxes has been provided on
	approximately $4,000,000 of such cumulative undistributed earnings.&#160;
	Determination of the potential amount of unrecognized deferred U.S. income tax
	liability and foreign withholding taxes is not practicable because of the
	complexities associated with its hypothetical calculation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">

<DIV ALIGN=LEFT>
<TABLE CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100%;">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;">
<TD WIDTH=10% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0PT 0IN 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	10.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Stock Options
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	On
	February 21, 2000, the Company's Board of Directors approved the adoption of
	the 2000 Incentive Stock Option Plan (the &#8220;Plan&#8221;) for TOR Minerals
	International, Inc.&#160; The Plan provides for the award of a variety of incentive
	compensation arrangements, including restricted stock awards, performance units
	or other non-option awards, to such employees and directors as may be
	determined by a Committee of the Board.&#160; At the Annual Shareholders&#8217; meeting on
	May 11, 2012, the maximum number of shares of the Company&#8217;s common stock that
	may be sold or issued under the Plan was increased to 500,000 shares subject to
	certain adjustments upon recapitalization, stock splits and combinations,
	merger, stock dividend and similar events; in addition the Plan was extended to
	May 23, 2022.&#160;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:10.0PT;MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	For the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, the
	Company recorded $133,000 and $128,000, respectively, in stock-based employee
	compensation.&#160; This compensation cost is included in the general and
	administrative expenses and cost of sales in the accompanying consolidated
	statements of operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company granted options to purchase 6,000 and 20,500 shares
	of common stock during the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014.&#160; The
	weighted average fair value per option at the date of grant for options granted
	in the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014 was $4.06 and $10.34,
	respectively, as valued using the Black-Scholes option-pricing model with the
	following weighted average assumptions:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The risk free interest rate is based on the Treasury
	Constant Maturity Rate as quoted by the Federal Reserve at the time of the
	grant for a term equivalent to the expected term of the grant.&#160; The estimated
	volatility is based on the historical volatility of our stock and other
	factors.&#160; The expected term of options represents the period of time the
	options are expected to be outstanding from grant date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD WIDTH=10% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0PT 0IN 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	11.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Profit Sharing
	Plan
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company has a profit sharing plan that covers the U.S. employees.&#160;
	Contributions to the plan are at the option of and determined by the Board of
	Directors and are limited to the maximum amount deductible by the Company for
	Federal income tax purposes.&#160; For the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014,
	there were no contributions to the plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company also offers U.S. employees a 401(k) savings plan administered by an
	investment services company.&#160; Employees are eligible to participate in the plan
	after completing six months of service with the Company.&#160; The Company matches
	contributions up to 4% of the employee's eligible earnings.&#160; Total Company
	contributions to the 401(k) plan for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014
	was approximately $72,000 and $63,000, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV ALIGN=LEFT>
<TABLE CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100%;">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;">
<TD WIDTH=10% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0PT 0IN 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	12.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Derivatives and Other
	Financial Instruments
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The Company has
	exposure to certain risks relating to its ongoing business operations,
	including financial, market, political and economic risks.&#160; The following
	discussion provides information regarding our exposure to the risks of changing
	foreign currency exchange rates.&#160; The Company has not entered into these contracts
	for trading or speculative purposes in the past, nor do we currently anticipate
	entering into such contracts for trading or speculative purposes in the
	future.&#160; The foreign exchange contracts are used to mitigate uncertainty and
	volatility, and to cover underlying exposures.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Foreign Currency Forward Contracts
</FONT>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	We manage the risk
	of changes in foreign currency exchange rates, primarily at our Malaysian
	operation, through the use of foreign currency contracts.&#160; Foreign exchange
	contracts are used to protect the Company from the risk that the eventual cash
	flows resulting from transactions in foreign currencies, including sales and
	purchases transacted in a currency other than the functional currency, will be
	adversely affected by changes in exchange rates.&#160; We report the fair value of
	the derivatives on our consolidated balance sheets and changes in the fair
	value are recognized in earnings in the period of the change.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	At December 31,
	2015 and 2014, we marked these contracts to market, recording $6,000 and
	$26,000, respectively, as a current liability on the consolidated balance sheets.&#160;
	For the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, we recorded a net loss on these
	contracts of $80,000 and $8,000, respectively, as a component of our net loss.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<A NAME="KMARCH4EDGAR1_HTM__BCLFOOTER67">
</A>
</FONT>

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;LAYOUT-GRID-MODE:LINE;">
	F &#8211; 26
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:9.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;

<DIV ALIGN=LEFT>
<TABLE CELLPADDING=0 CELLSPACING=0 BORDER=0 STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH:100%;">
<TR STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;">
<TD WIDTH=10% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 0PT 0IN 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	13.
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
<TD WIDTH=90% STYLE="HEIGHT:13.0PT;PADDING:0IN 5.4PT 0IN 5.4PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<B>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" STYLE="FONT-SIZE:11.0PT;">
	Commitments and
	Contingencies
</FONT>
</B>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<B>
<I>
<U>
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Land Lease
</FONT>
</U>
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	The
	Company operates a plant in Corpus Christi, Texas.&#160; The facility is located in
	the Rincon Industrial Park on approximately 15 acres of land, with 13 acres
	leased from the Port of Corpus Christi Authority (the &quot;Port&quot;) and
	approximately two acres owned by the Company.&#160; The lease payment is subject to
	an adjustment every 5 years for what the Port calls the &quot;equalization
	valuation&quot;.&#160; This is used as a means of equalizing rentals on various Port
	lands and is determined solely at the discretion of the Port.&#160; The last
	equalization valuation was July 2012 at which time the annual lease increased
	from approximately $54,000 to $95,000.&#160; The Company and the Port executed an
	amended lease agreement on July 11, 2000, which extended the expiration date of
	the lease to June 30, 2027.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	Minimum future rental payments for non-cancelable leases
	as of December 31, 2015 for the next five years ending December 31 and in total
	thereafter are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;">
<FONT FACE="TIMES NEW ROMAN" LANG=EN-US STYLE="FONT-SIZE:10.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

	and $117,000 for the years ended December 31, 2015 and 2014, respectively.

	are claims arising in the normal course of business that are pending against

<DIV CLASS="eolNewPage"></DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage73"></A>
<A NAME="EXHIBIT31CEO_HTM"></A>
<EFX_EXHIBIT_31>
<A NAME="FIS_EXHIBIT_31"></A>
<P CLASS=HP ALIGN=RIGHT STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT'>
<B>
	Exhibit 31.1
</B>
</P>
<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION"></A>
<P CLASS=HP ALIGN=CENTER STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER'>
<B>
	CERTIFICATIONS
</B>
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	I, Olaf Karasch, certify that:
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	1. I have reviewed this Form 10-K of TOR Minerals International, Inc.;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	2. Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue
	statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make
	the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements
	were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial
	information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects
	the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant
	as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	4. The registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible
	for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined
	in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over
	financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f)) for
	the registrant and have:
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such
	disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to
	ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its
	consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities,
	particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused
	such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our
	supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of
	financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external
	purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls
	and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the
	effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the
	period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant's internal
	control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most
	recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an
	annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
	materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting;
	and
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	5. The registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed,
	based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial
	reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the
	registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent
	functions):
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design
	or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably
	likely to adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process,
	summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or
	other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal
	control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	Date: March 7,2016
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
<B>
<U>
	/s/ Olaf Karasch
</U>
</B>
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	Olaf Karasch
</P>
	President and CEO
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<DIV CLASS=HP ALIGN=CENTER STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER'>
<HR SIZE=2 WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR=NAVY ALIGN=CENTER>
</DIV>
</EFX_CERTIFICATION>
</EFX_EXHIBIT_31>

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_2"></A>

	CERTIFICATIONS
</B>
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	I, Barbara Russell, certify that:
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	1. I have reviewed this Form 10-K of TOR Minerals International, Inc.;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	2. Based on my knowledge, this report does not contain any untrue
	statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make
	the statements made, in light of the circumstances under which such statements
	were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this report;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	3. Based on my knowledge, the financial statements, and other financial
	information included in this report, fairly present in all material respects
	the financial condition, results of operations and cash flows of the registrant
	as of, and for, the periods presented in this report;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	4. The registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I are responsible
	for establishing and maintaining disclosure controls and procedures (as defined
	in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(e) and 15d-15(e)) and internal control over
	financial reporting (as defined in Exchange Act Rules 13a-15(f) and 15d-15(f))
	for the registrant and have:
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(a) Designed such disclosure controls and procedures, or caused such
	disclosure controls and procedures to be designed under our supervision, to
	ensure that material information relating to the registrant, including its
	consolidated subsidiaries, is made known to us by others within those entities,
	particularly during the period in which this report is being prepared;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(b) Designed such internal control over financial reporting, or caused
	such internal control over financial reporting to be designed under our
	supervision, to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of
	financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external
	purposes in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(c) Evaluated the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls
	and procedures and presented in this report our conclusions about the
	effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures, as of the end of the
	period covered by this report based on such evaluation; and
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(d) Disclosed in this report any change in the registrant's internal
	control over financial reporting that occurred during the registrant's most
	recent fiscal quarter (the registrant's fourth fiscal quarter in the case of an
	annual report) that has materially affected, or is reasonably likely to
	materially affect, the registrant's internal control over financial reporting;
	and
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	5. The registrant's other certifying officer(s) and I have disclosed,
	based on our most recent evaluation of internal control over financial
	reporting, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the
	registrant's board of directors (or persons performing the equivalent
	functions):
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(a) All significant deficiencies and material weaknesses in the design
	or operation of internal control over financial reporting which are reasonably
	likely to adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process,
	summarize and report financial information; and
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	(b) Any fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or
	other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal
	control over financial reporting.
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	Date: March 7, 2016

</U>
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	Barbara Russell
</P>
<P CLASS=HP STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT'>
	Chief
	Financial Officer
</P>
<DIV CLASS=HP ALIGN=CENTER STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER'>
<HR SIZE=2 WIDTH="100%" NOSHADE COLOR=NAVY ALIGN=CENTER>
</DIV>
</EFX_CERTIFICATION>

<EFX_CERTIFICATION>
<A NAME="FIS_CERTIFICATION_3"></A>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER'>
<B>
<BR>
<BR>
	CERTIFICATION PURSUANT TO
<BR>
	18 U.S.C. SECTION 1350,
<BR>
	AS ADOPTED PURSUANT TO
<BR>
	SECTION 906 OF THE SARBANES-OXLEY ACT OF 2002
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER'>
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P ALIGN=CENTER STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER'>
<B>
	&nbsp;
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY'>
	In connection with the Annual Report of TOR Minerals
	International, Inc. (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) on Form 10-K for the year ended
	December 31, 2015, as filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission on the
	date hereof (the &#8220;Report&#8221;), I, Olaf Karasch, President and Chief
	Executive Officer of the Company, certify, pursuant to 18 U.S.C. Section 1350,
	as adopted pursuant to Section 906 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, that to
	my knowledge:
</P>
<P STYLE='MARGIN:0IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=MSONORMAL STYLE='MARGIN-TOP:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:.5IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN; MARGIN-LEFT:.75IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN'>
	1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Report fully complies with the
	requirements of Section 13(a) or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934,
	as amended, and
</P>
<P CLASS=MSONORMAL STYLE='MARGIN-TOP:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:.5IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN; MARGIN-LEFT:.75IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN'>
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P CLASS=MSONORMAL STYLE='MARGIN-TOP:0IN;MARGIN-RIGHT:.5IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0IN; MARGIN-LEFT:.75IN;MARGIN-BOTTOM:.0001PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-INDENT:-.25IN'>
	2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The information contained in the
	Report fairly presents, in all material respects, the financial condition and
	results of operations of the Company for the year ended December 31, 2015.
</P>
<P CLASS=MSOFOOTER>
<B>
<U>
	/s/ OLAF KARASCH
</U>
</B>
<U>
<BR>
</U>
	Olaf Karasch
<BR>
	President and Chief Executive Officer
<BR>
	March 7, 2016
